channel.title: Installing ASP on Xampp ran on Windows Vista?
channel.description:
I tried, but it didn't go quite well. Anyone have a good tutorial on how to?
Used this one, but didn't work for [b]ME[/b]. http://mschat.net/forum/index.php?topic=574.0

item.title: Installing ASP on Xampp ran on Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @xKadir xKadir
item.description:
@xKadir wrote:

I’m downloading xubuntu right now, to try it out.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing ASP on Xampp ran on Windows Vista?

item.title: Installing ASP on Xampp ran on Windows Vista?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:7, topic:279446”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=368770.msg2792337#msg2792337 date=1242856732]
Vista as a server, do you love major headaches? Install xubuntu as dual boot (WUBI if you want) and run it from there, it will be much easier for all concerned.
[/quote]
I used to run a Windows 2003 server (which was not that bad), but I had to reboot every 3 days or so. Contrary, my Linux home server (in the corner of my room) has a 186 day uptime.[/quote]

The server this site is hosted on was up for 383 days before I rebooted to use a new kernel. I’ve never ran windows as a server, but when I used to use XP and left it on overnight to download a very big file it always was extremely slow until I restarted it, pretty much to the point of not being usable.

Read full topic
